title: Use Blank Blocks to Write Code
description: Put the blank block above the two blocks of code and write an output command that outputs the message I wrote the code to output this text. Remember the output command uses the word output followed by two double quotes. Inside the two double quotes are the words to output.
answer: I wrote the code to output this text
hint:
You should have typed the command output "I wrote the code to output this text". If you received an error in the output window check your typed code for mistakes. Checking for these types of errors is something programmers spend a lot of time doing.

In the future, when you feel you have mastered a command, try typing it yourself in a blank block.
